column4: my install of breezy stopped (i dont think it was finish...but unsure)  because of a bug (i had forgot to remove the Cd rom of hoary from the list of sources) i removed it in the sources, not apt-get update works well, but i dont know how to 'restart the install'
please..
do i jsut redo apt-dist upgrade ?
upgrading
to breezy
damn took like 2 hours,  ..nyway
thx
it shouldn't restart any downloads, just restart where it left off
you can extract it with tar -xvjf <file>
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/AutomaticallyMountMSWindowsPartitions
the script worked well, although mouting my winHD with a weird name... and i see no sign of how to edit the partitions name :\
is it in /etc/fstab?
see if the label is in /etc/fstab
http://www.rafb.net/paste/results/K94HWY93.html
ok, what name would you like? :)
ok, first "sudo umount /dev/hda1"
now "sudo mv /media/*hda1* /media/windows"
then "sudo gedit /etc/fstab" and change "/media/0\040GB\040Disk\040(hda1)" to "/media/windows" on that line
(save and exit the editor) now "sudo mount -a"
, wow :) nice thnx a lot...saved me a few hours of web search :)
np, hopefully it looks a bit better now :)
lol
'sudo fdisk -l' will show you all partitions (including the unmounted ones)
sound-juicer can, but requires mp3 libraries to be installed.  Either the RestrictedFormats wiki page or the forums can help with that
